Question: "what's diabound kernel's effect?"
Answer:
"Ah, Diabound Kernel, an interesting card choice indeed. Let me enlighten you with its effect, as I am the great Seto Kaiba, the master of the Duel Monsters game.

Diabound Kernel's effect is quite simple, yet effective. When this card is Normal Summoned or Special Summoned, you get to target one monster your opponent controls and equip it to Diabound Kernel. Yes, you heard that right, I said "equip." Just like how I equip my Blue-Eyes White Dragon with the Crush Card Virus, Diabound Kernel has the power to snatch your opponent's monster and use it for its own purposes.

But that's not all! Once per turn, during your Standby Phase, Diabound Kernel gains 1000 ATK for each monster it has equipped. Now, isn't that a delightful bonus? The more monsters you steal, the stronger Diabound Kernel becomes. It's like building an army of stolen souls to crush your opponent's pathetic attempts at victory.

Oh, and did I mention that Diabound Kernel also has the ability to protect itself? Yes, it's true! If this card would be destroyed by battle or card effect, you can simply destroy one of the monsters it has equipped instead. How convenient! It's like having a personal shield that sacrifices your opponent's monsters instead of your own.

So, there you have it, the marvelous effect of Diabound Kernel. It's a card that not only steals your opponent's monsters but also grows stronger with each stolen soul. Just remember, when you use this card, you're channeling the power of the mighty Seto Kaiba himself. Now go forth and dominate the Duel Monsters game with the power of Diabound Kernel!"

Question: "Give me the card effect of dark necrofear"
Answer: "The effect of Dark Necrofear is as follows: "If this card is in your hand or GY: You can send 1 face-up Continuous Trap you control to the GY; Special Summon this card, but banish it when it leaves the field. If this card is destroyed by battle or card effect and sent to the GY: You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; equip this card to that target. If that target would be destroyed by battle or card effect, destroy this card instead. During the End Phase, if this card is equipped to a monster: Take control of that monster.""

Question: "what's diabound kernel's effect?"
Answer: "Diabound Kernel's effect is as follows: When this card is Normal Summoned, you can target 1 Level 4 or lower monster in your Graveyard; Special Summon that target in Defense Position. If this card is destroyed by battle or card effect and sent to the Graveyard: You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy that target, then you can Special Summon 1 "Diabound Kernel" from your hand or Deck. This effect can only be used once while this card is face-up on the field."

Question: "what's diabound kernel's effect?"
Answer:
"Diabound Kernel's effect is as follows: 
- When this card declares an attack, it gains 600 ATK.
- As a Quick Effect, you can target 1 face-up monster your opponent controls. That monster loses ATK equal to Diabound Kernel's current ATK until the end of the turn.
- After using this effect, Diabound Kernel is banished until the Standby Phase of the next turn.
- You can only use this effect of Diabound Kernel once per turn."

Question: "give me the description of the card dark necrofear"
Answer: "Dark Necrofear is an Effect Monster card with 2200 ATK and 2800 DEF. It cannot be Normal Summoned or Set, but must be Special Summoned from your hand by banishing 3 Fiend monsters from your Graveyard. If Dark Necrofear is destroyed in your Monster Zone by an opponent's card and sent to the Graveyard during the same turn, during the End Phase, you can target 1 face-up monster your opponent controls and equip Dark Necrofear to it. While equipped to a monster, you gain control of that monster."

Question: "give me the description of mad archfiend"
Answer: "Mad Archfiend is a Level 4 DARK Fiend-type Effect Monster with 1800 ATK and 0 DEF. When this card attacks a Defense Position monster, it inflicts piercing battle damage to your opponent. Additionally, if this face-up Attack Position card is targeted for an attack, it can be changed to Defense Position. Mad Archfiend can be found in various sets such as 2-Player Starter Deck: Yuya & Declan and Crossroads of Chaos. Its card image can be viewed [here](https://images.ygoprodeck.com/images/cards/94664694.jpg)."

Question:
"give me the description of bottomless trap hole
"
Answer: "Bottomless Trap Hole is a Trap Card that activates when your opponent Summons a monster(s) with 1500 or more ATK. It destroys the summoned monster(s) with 1500 or more ATK and banishes them from the game. This card can be useful for removing powerful monsters from your opponent's field and preventing them from being used again. It is a staple card in many competitive decks and can be found in various sets, including Battles of Legend: Relentless Revenge and Legendary Collection 3: Yugi's World Mega Pack."

Question:
"would bottomless trap hole work on blue eyes
"

Bottomless Trap Hole will then destroy and remove Blue-Eyes White Dragon from the field, preventing it from resolving its effect."
